decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost creatures and spells, using counterspells to control the board and protect your own threats. The deck aims to maintain card advantage through draw spells like Thought Scour and Brainstorm. Lórien Revealed helps to provide additional card filtering and selection. Cryptic Serpent serves as a powerful finisher, while Deem Inferior can cripple the opponent's hand. Delver of Secrets provides early pressure, with Sleep of the Dead for additional control. Deep Analysis offers late-game card advantage.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the game using the Urzatron lands to generate mana quickly and efficiently. By using cards like Mnemonic Wall to recur spells, Expedition Map to fetch lands, and Prophetic Prism to draw cards, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and establish a dominant position on the board. With removal spells like Moment's Peace and counterspells like Prohibit, along with powerful finishers like Mulldrifter and Stonehorn Dignitary, the deck is able to protect itself while setting up a win condition.

The deck focuses on using control elements to slow down the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana production through Gates. It utilizes a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw to maintain board control and card advantage. The win condition is to secure the board with efficient creatures like Sacred Cat and Squadron Hawk, while also having access to powerful threats like Lórien Revealed. The deck aims to outlast and outvalue the opponent by leveraging the synergy between Gates and control spells.

This Orzhov Aggro deck focuses on flooding the board with small creatures and utilizing cards like Tithing Blade and Lembas to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes disruption and removal spells like Cast Down and Suffocating Fumes to control the opponent's board while continuing to attack. The deck's mana base allows for a consistent mix of white and black spells, with bounce lands and artifact lands providing additional synergy with cards like Glint Hawk and Kor Skyfisher. Overall, the deck aims to quickly wear down the opponent's life total and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently assemble the Balustrade Spy combo to mill your entire library and win the game. By utilizing cards like Land Grant and Lead the Stampede to dig for combo pieces, along with creatures like Elves of Deep Shadow and Gatecreeper Vine to ramp up mana production, the deck aims to set up the combo as soon as possible. With the ability to return creatures from the graveyard with Dread Return, the deck can execute its game-winning strategy while also maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this Golgari/Jund Garden deck is to control the game by using removal spells and sacrificing creatures for value. The deck includes a mix of removal spells like Cast Down and Defile, along with creature sacrifice effects like Fanatical Offering. Additionally, the deck includes utility lands like Bojuka Bog and Khalni Garden to provide additional value. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through sacrificing creatures and exploiting the graveyard with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Pulse of Murasa.

The deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using an unconventional Jund color combination. It utilizes cards that provide value when sacrificed or destroyed, such as Writhing Chrysalis and Drossforge Bridge. The strategy involves sacrificing artifacts for benefits, disrupting opponents with removal spells like Cast Down and Krark-Clan Shaman, and overwhelming them with powerful creatures like Fungal Colossus. The deck also has some land destruction elements with Cleansing Wildfire and utilizes various artifacts to generate mana and card advantage.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively use cheap and efficient creatures like Goblin Tomb Raider and Burning-Tree Emissary, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Galvanic Blast, to quickly deal damage to the opponent and win the game as fast as possible. Additional support cards like Rally at the Hornburg and Wrenn's Resolve help to maintain pressure and ensure a steady stream of threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swift and relentless assault, utilizing a mixture of creatures and direct damage spells to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing Gates and control spells to stall the opponent while generating card advantage with Squadron Hawk and The Modern Age. The key strategy is to control the board using removal spells like Journey to Nowhere and Prismatic Strands, while also countering threats with Counterspell and Dispel. The mana base is built around various Gates to ensure smooth color fixing and ramping with Basilisk Gate. Outlaw Medic provides lifegain to survive aggro matchups, while Guardian of the Guildpact acts as a resilient threat against removal-heavy decks.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and sacrificing them to deal damage to the opponent while also being able to draw cards and generate mana efficiently. This aggressive strategy allows the player to apply pressure early in the game and maintain a constant stream of threats on the battlefield. The deck also includes spells to disrupt the opponent's strategies and provide utility in handling various scenarios. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and efficient spells, making it a formidable force in the Pauper 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept of this deck is to control the board through removal spells and sacrifice effects, while generating value with cards like Campfire, Ichor Wellspring, and Pestilence. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by using cards like Nutrient Block and Lembas to gain life, and creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Troll of Khazad-dûm to provide a constant stream of threats. The deck also utilizes Golgari Rot Farm and Khalni Garden to ramp and generate token creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on attrition and resource management to outlast opponents.

The focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using a combination of efficient creatures like Kitchen Imp and Voldaren Epicure, along with burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Fiery Temper. By applying pressure from the start and utilizing cards like Alms of the Vein to drain the opponent's life total, this deck aims to win the game as quickly as possible. Additionally, cards like Grab the Prize and Vampire's Kiss provide additional ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain pressure on the battlefield.

The main strategy of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of countermagic, creature removal, and card advantage to control the tempo of the game. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Cast Down, and Snuff Out, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while also generating card advantage through spells like Brainstorm and Augur of Bolas. The inclusion of Murmuring Mystic and Spellstutter Sprite provides additional threats and ways to pressure the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to outmaneuver and outlast the opponent through careful resource management and efficient use of removal and countermagic spells.

This Pauper Aggro Jund deck focuses on sacrificing creatures for value and card advantage while quickly ramping up to powerful threats like Nyxborn Hydra. It utilizes cards like Refurbished Familiar and Fanatical Offering to keep a steady stream of creatures on the battlefield, while also disrupting opponents with cards like Nihil Spellbomb. The deck also includes removal spells like Cast Down and Cleansing Wildfire to control the board, allowing for explosive finishes with cards like Writhing Chrysalis and Eviscerator's Insight.

The deck revolves around using artifact creatures and sacrificing them with Makeshift Munitions to deal damage to the opponent. It also incorporates the Affinity mechanic to cast spells for reduced costs by controlling a high number of artifacts. The deck includes various artifacts such as Myr Enforcer and Ichor Wellspring to take advantage of these synergies, while also having removal spells like Galvanic Blast and Krark-Clan Shaman to maintain board control. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Thoughtcast for card advantage and disruption.

The main focus of this Boros Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The deck includes efficient creatures like Kor Skyfisher and Glint Hawk, as well as removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Journey to Nowhere to control the board. The deck also includes life gain lands like Kabira Crossroads and Radiant Fountain to help increase survivability, while cards like Relic of Progenitus provide graveyard hate against potential strategies. Overall, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and finish them off with direct damage spells.
